SEARCH
Package edu.newsbot

Class DB

java.lang.Object
edu.newsbot.DB
public class DB extends Object
Handles database operations for the application, including connection management, table creation, RSS feed insertion, and DB tables information retrieval.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    DB()
    Default constructor.

  • Constructor Details

    • DB

      public DB()
      Default constructor. Used for initializing the DB class. This class provides methods to establish connections to the database.

  • Method Details

    • connect

      public static Connection connect() throws SQLException
      Establishes a connection to the database using credentials (username, password, url) from the DatabaseConfig class.
      Returns:
      A Connection object to the database.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs or the url is null.

    • createTables

      public static void createTables()
      Creates necessary tables in the database if they do not already exist. tables: bot_user (id, telegram_id UNIQUE, sources, age, language, delta_time) science_daily_feeds (id, link, name) article (id, title, summary, link, datetime, full_story, source. related_topics, related_terms, journal_reference, cite_page_mla, cite_page_apa, cite_page_chicago TEXT, related_stories_links TEXT) user_article_status (id, telegram_id REFERENCES bot_user(telegram_id), article_id INT REFERENCES article(id), read_status DEFAULT FALSE, UNIQUE(telegram_id, article_id))

    • insertRssFeedsFromFile

      public static void insertRssFeedsFromFile(String filePath) throws SQLException
      Inserts RSS feeds into the database from a specified file.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the file containing RSS feed URLs.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

    • getRssFeedsNames

      public static ArrayList<String> getRssFeedsNames()
      Retrieves the names of all RSS feeds stored in the database.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of RSS feed names.

    • getRssFeedsLinkByName

      public static String getRssFeedsLinkByName(String name)
      Retrieves the link for a specific RSS feed by its name.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the RSS feed.
      Returns:
      The link of the RSS feed, or null if not found.

    • clearAllTables

      public static void clearAllTables()
      Clears all tables in the database, effectively resetting the database.

    • getUserInfoByUserId

      public static Map<String,Object> getUserInfoByUserId(long userId)
      Retrieves information about a user from the database based on their user ID.
      Parameters:
      userId - The user's Telegram ID.
      Returns:
      A Map containing user information, or null if the user is not found.

    • updateOrInsertUserInfo

      public static void updateOrInsertUserInfo(Map<String,String> updateData)
      Updates or inserts user information into the database. Used for registration and settings changes.
      Parameters:
      updateData - a Map containing the data to update or insert

    • rescheduleTasks

      public static void rescheduleTasks(Long telegramId) throws SQLException
      Reschedules tasks based on updated user information.
      Parameters:
      telegramId - the telegram ID of the user
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • saveArticleToDatabase

      public static void saveArticleToDatabase(String primaryUrl, Map<String,String> dataMap)
      Saves an article to the database and updates the user-article status accordingly.
      Parameters:
      primaryUrl - the primary URL associated with the article
      dataMap - a Map containing the article data

    • getFirstUnreadArticleForUser

      public static Map<String,String> getFirstUnreadArticleForUser(long telegramId)
      Retrieves the first unread article for a given user, along with the total number of unread articles.
      Parameters:
      telegramId - The telegram ID of the user for whom to retrieve the article.
      Returns:
      A map containing details of the first unread article and the count of unread articles.

    • markFirstUnreadArticleAsRead

      public static void markFirstUnreadArticleAsRead(long telegramId)
      Marks the first unread article as read for a specific user. This method updates the read status of the user's first unread article in the database.
      Parameters:
      telegramId - The telegram ID of the user for whom the article should be marked as read.

    • markAllUnreadArticlesAsRead

      public static void markAllUnreadArticlesAsRead(long telegramId)
      Marks all unread articles as read for a specific user. This method updates the read status of all the user's unread articles in the database.
      Parameters:
      telegramId - The telegram ID of the user for whom all unread articles should be marked as read.

    • deleteAllUserArticles

      public static void deleteAllUserArticles(long telegramId)
      Deletes all articles associated with a specific user. This method removes all user-article associations for a given user from the database.
      Parameters:
      telegramId - The telegram ID of the user for whom all articles should be deleted.
